thread.title: Germany probes complaint alleging Facebook incitement
thread.title_full: Germany probes complaint alleging Facebook incitement | The Financial Express

author: financialexpress.com
title: Germany probes complaint alleging Facebook incitement
text:
Other Articles Meru Cabs joins Taxis G7 alliance; eyes foreign tourists Mahindra Gusto Special Edition Launched With New Dual-Tone Colours; Priced at Rs. 49,350 JSW Steel July-September profit slides 84% German prosecutors are examining a criminal complaint against three people alleging that Facebook facilitates incitement.
Nana Frombach, a spokeswoman for prosecutors in Hamburg, said Monday her authority has opened an investigation but is still trying to establish whether there is a case for anyone to answer.
News portal Spiegel Online reported that the people targeted by the complaints are listed as managers of Facebook Germany GmbH, a unit based in Hamburg.
Spiegel Online said the complaint was filed by a Bavaria-based lawyer who pointed to hate speech on Facebook related to the refugee crisis and other matters. Facebook didnâ€™t immediately comment on the case.
German officials have met Facebook representatives to push for faster deletion of hate speech.
 20, 2015 4:00 am
